author: Don Kaplan
title: Tamron Hall's departure sparks accusation of NBC 'whitewashing'
text:
Tamron Hall's 'Today' departure sparks accusation of NBC News 'whitewashing' Tamron Hall's departure sparks accusation of NBC 'whitewashing' NEW YORK DAILY NEWS   5:56 PM 
The National Association of Black Journalists has ripped NBC News - accusing the network of “whitewashing” the “Today” show to make room for Megyn Kelly. 
Hall, who turned down a multimillion dollar deal this week to remain on the “Today” show and keep her MSNBC program, broke new ground as as the first female, black co-host of NBC’s hugely profitable morning show. 
Kelly, the controversial former-Fox News Channel star, will host her own hour of “Today” starting next fall. 
The National Association of Black Journalists (NABJ) is saddened by Tamron Hall's departure from NBC,” the organization said in a statement. Megyn Kelly 
“ She broke ground as the first black female `Today Show’ cohost and was enjoying ratings success alongside Al Roker during the show's third hour of programming. NBC has been a leader for diversity in broadcasting, but recent reports that Hall and Roker will be replaced by former Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly are being seen by industry professionals as whitewashing.” 
NBC News insiders said that Hall was livid when she learned that the 9 a.m. hour of “Today” that she co-hosts with weatherman Al Roker would be bumped. 
Kelly is expected to take over either the 9 a.m. hour or the 10 a.m. hour currently hosted by Kathie Lee Gifford and Hoda Kotb - who would move to a different timeslot.
